title: RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > Overview > Description > RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Gateway Overview
content: The **RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Gateway** is a device that consists of Raspberry Pi 4, RAK2245 Pi HAT which includes a GPS module and a Heat Sink for better performance and thermal heat dissipation management, and a RAK2013 Cellular Pi HAT and its housing is built with an aluminum casing.
parent_content:
The **RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Gateway** is a device that consists of Raspberry Pi 4, RAK2245 Pi HAT which includes a GPS module and a Heat Sink for better performance and thermal heat dissipation management, and a RAK2013 Cellular Pi HAT and its housing is built with an aluminum casing.  
For the built-in RAK2245 Pi HAT, the SX1301 chip from Semtech is used, which is a built-in LPWAN concentrator IP core, a powerful digital signal processing engine. It can receive up to 8 LoRa packets simultaneously sent with different spreading factors on different channels and is available in multiple options so it can be used for international standard bands. This unique capability allows for the implementation of innovative network architectures advantageous over other short-range systems. For the build-in RAK2013 Cellular Pi HAT, it supports optional QUECTEL BG96 / EG91 / EG95 which can support NB-IoT / CAT-M / CAT1 LTE / CAT4 LTE. It follows Raspberry Pi specifications and is easy to mount with Raspberry Pi and RAK2245 Pi HAT module.  
Pilot Gateway Pro is ideal for prototyping, proof-of-concept demonstration, or evaluation. It includes a ready-to-use gateway OS that can be connected to a LoRaWan server. Also, it is developer-friendly and easy even for not-so-techy users to set up the LoRaWan system. It has to be the best value and function for connectivity to address a variety of applications like Smart Grid, Intelligent Farm, and other IoT enterprise applications.

title: RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > Specifications > Overview > RAK7244C Board Overview and LoRaWAN System Concept
content: The overview covers the board overview of RAK7244C and its block diagram that discusses the basic concept of the LoRaWAN system.
parent_content: The overview covers the board overview of RAK7244C and its block diagram that discusses the basic concept of the LoRaWAN system.

title: RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > Specifications > Overview > Block Diagram > LoRaWAN System Concept with RAK7244C Pilot Gateway
content:
**Figure 2** shows the basic concept for the LoRaWAN system. **RAK7244C Pilot Gateway** is the central hardware solution for all LoRa-based radio communications. It receives and transmits radio messages. The processing of radio messages, as well as the protocol-related tasks, are done by the embedded host system (Raspberry Pi). Received and processed radio messages are sent to a LoRaWAN server.  
The concrete segmentation of the protocol-related tasks is outside the scope of this document.

The concrete segmentation of the protocol-related tasks is outside the scope of this document.  
> **Image:** RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Gateway system structure

title: RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Interfaces > RAK7244C LTE Antenna Interface [NOTE]
content:
> **Image:** RAK7244C Interfaces  
> **TIP:** NOTE  
The LTE antenna (DIV) is used only for the EG91/ EG95 Version and is reserved for the BG96 Version.

title: RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Pin Definition > RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Gateway Composition
content: The RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Gateway is composed of the LPWAN Concentrator RAK2245 Pi HAT and the RAK2013 Pi HAT for cellular connectivity.
parent_content: The RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Gateway is composed of the LPWAN Concentrator RAK2245 Pi HAT and the RAK2013 Pi HAT for cellular connectivity.

title: RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Pin Definition > RAK2245 Pi HAT > RAK2245 Pi HAT Overview
content:
> **Image:** RAK2245 Pi HAT  
RAK2245 Pi HAT is an LPWAN Concentrator board that follows the Pi HAT standard and can be mounted to a Pi board with a 40-pin connector.  
- For detailed information about the RAK2245, go to the [RAK2245 Pi HAT Datasheet](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wislink/rak2245-pi-hat/datasheet/).
parent_content:
> **Image:** RAK2245 Pi HAT  
RAK2245 Pi HAT is an LPWAN Concentrator board that follows the Pi HAT standard and can be mounted to a Pi board with a 40-pin connector.  
- For detailed information about the RAK2245, go to the [RAK2245 Pi HAT Datasheet](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wislink/rak2245-pi-hat/datasheet/).

title: RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Pin Definition > RAK2013 Cellular > RAK2013 Cellular Overview and Features
content:
> **Image:** RAK2013 Cellular  
RAK2013 is an add-on board following Raspberry Pi HAT standard. It can transmit UART data from Raspberry Pi to a Cellular network. It can support several cellular protocols, such as NB-IoT, CAT-M, CAT1, or CAT 4, by choosing different modular on the board.
parent_content:
> **Image:** RAK2013 Cellular  
RAK2013 is an add-on board following Raspberry Pi HAT standard. It can transmit UART data from Raspberry Pi to a Cellular network. It can support several cellular protocols, such as NB-IoT, CAT-M, CAT1, or CAT 4, by choosing different modular on the board.  
The RAK2013 integrates an audio codec and audio amplifier on it with the carrier operator's network. It can support the VoLTE function. For easy use, there are an earphone connector, a MIC connector, and a speaker connector with an audio amplifier.  
- For detailed information about the RAK2013, go to [RAK2013 Cellular Datasheet](https://docs.rakwireless.comhttps://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wislink/rak2013/datasheet/).  
> **Image:** Cellular hardware structure

The RAK2013 integrates an audio codec and audio amplifier on it with the carrier operator's network. It can support the VoLTE function. For easy use, there are an earphone connector, a MIC connector, and a speaker connector with an audio amplifier.

title: RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > RF Characteristics > Operating Frequencies > Supported LoRaWAN Frequency Channels [TABLE]
content:
The pilot gateway supports all LoRaWAN frequency channels shown below. The operating frequency is configured while building the firmware from the source code.  
|    Region     | Frequency (MHz)  |
| :-----------: | :--------------: |
|    Europe     | EU433
EU868 |
|     China     |      CN470       |
| North America |      US915       |
|     Asia      |      AS923       |
|   Australia   |      AU915       |
|     Korea     |      KR920       |
|     India     |      IN865       |

title: RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > LoRa > Transmitter RF > RAK2245 Transmitter Performance and Configuration [TABLE]
content:
The RAK2245 has an excellent transmitter performance. It is highly recommended to use an optimized configuration for the power level configuration, which is part of the HAL. This results in a mean RF output power level and current consumption.  
| PA Control | DAC Control | MIX Control | DIG Gain | Nominal RF Power Level (dBm) |
| :--------: | :---------: | :---------: | :------: | :--------------------------: |
|     0      |      3      |      8      |    0     |              -6              |

| PA Control | DAC Control | MIX Control | DIG Gain | Nominal RF Power Level (dBm) |
| :--------: | :---------: | :---------: | :------: | :--------------------------: |
|     0      |      3      |      8      |    0     |              -6              |
|     0      |      3      |     10      |    0     |              -3              |
|     0      |      3      |     14      |    0     |              0               |
|     1      |      3      |      9      |    3     |              4               |
|     1      |      3      |      8      |    0     |              8               |
|     1      |      3      |      9      |    0     |              10              |
|     1      |      3      |     11      |    0     |              12              |
|     1      |      3      |     12      |    0     |              14              |
|     1      |      3      |     13      |    0     |              16              |
|     2      |      3      |     12      |    0     |              17              |
|     2      |      3      |     13      |    0     |              19              |
|     2      |      3      |     14      |    0     |              20              |
|     3      |      3      |     10      |    0     |              0               |
|     3      |      3      |     11      |    0     |              0               |
|     3      |      3      |     12      |    0     |              25              |
|     3      |      3      |     13      |    0     |              26              |
|     3      |      3      |     14      |    0     |              27              |  
- T=25℃, VDD=5V (Typ.) if nothing else is stated.  
|                Parameter                |        Condition        |      Min      | Typ.  |      Max       |
| :-------------------------------------: | :---------------------: | :-----------: | :---: | :------------: |
|             Frequency Range             |            -            | 863Mhz  |   -   |  870Mhz  |
|          Modulation Techniques          |        FSK/LoRa         |       -       |   -   |       -        |
| TX Frequency Variations vs. Temperature | Power Level Setting: 20 |  -3kHz  |   -   |  +3kHz   |
|   TX Power Variation vs. Temperature    | Power Level Setting: 20 |  -5dBm  |   -   |  +5dBm   |
|           TX Power Variation            |            -            | -1.5dBm |   -   | >+1.5dBm |

title: RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > LoRa > Receiver RF > RAK2245 Sensitivity Levels [TABLE]
content:
It is highly recommended, to use optimized RSSI calibration values, which is part of the HAL v3.1. For both, Radio 1 and 2, the RSSI-Offset should be set - 169.0. The following table gives the typical sensitivity level of the RAK2245.  
| Signal Bandwidth (kHz) | Spreading Factor | Sensitivity (dBm) |
| :--------------------: | :--------------: | :---------------: |
|          125           |        12        |       -139        |
|          125           |        7         |       -126        |
parent_content:

|          125           |        7         |       -126        |
|          250           |        12        |       -136        |
|          250           |        7         |       -123        |
|          500           |        12        |       -134        |
|          500           |        7         |       -120        |

title: RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Cellular > Supported Frequency Bands for RAK7244C Pilot Gateway
content: The pilot gateway supports different frequency bands according to the modular mounted on the board.
parent_content: The pilot gateway supports different frequency bands according to the modular mounted on the board.

title: RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Cellular > BG96 Module > BG96 LTE Module Specifications [TABLE]
content:
BG96 is a series of LTE Cat M1/Cat NB1/EGPRS module offering a maximum data rate of 300kbps downlink and 375kbps uplink.  
|  Frequency   |                                 BG96                                  |
| :----------: | :-------------------------------------------------------------------: |
| LTE(FDD-LTE) | B1 / B2 / B3 / B4 / B5 / B8 / B12 / B13 / B18 / B19 / B20 / B26 / B28 |
| LTE(TDD-LTE) |                         B39 (for CAT M1 only)                         |
parent_content:
BG96 is a series of LTE Cat M1/Cat NB1/EGPRS module offering a maximum data rate of 300kbps downlink and 375kbps uplink.  
|  Frequency   |                                 BG96                                  |
| :----------: | :-------------------------------------------------------------------: |
| LTE(FDD-LTE) | B1 / B2 / B3 / B4 / B5 / B8 / B12 / B13 / B18 / B19 / B20 / B26 / B28 |
| LTE(TDD-LTE) |                         B39 (for CAT M1 only)                         |
|    EGPRS     |                   850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900MHz                    |

title: RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Antenna Specifications > LoRa > Antenna Dimensions > LoRa Antenna Mechanical Dimensions [FIGURE]

title: RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > RAK7244C WisGate Developer D4+ Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Antenna Specifications > LTE > Antenna Configuration for BG96, EG91, and EG95 Modules
content:
For a built-in BG96, there is one LTE antenna and one GPS antenna. For module built-in EG91/EG95, there are two LTE antennas and no GPS antenna.  
> **Image:** LTE Antenna
parent_content:
For a built-in BG96, there is one LTE antenna and one GPS antenna. For module built-in EG91/EG95, there are two LTE antennas and no GPS antenna.  
> **Image:** LTE Antenna
